p: Our study shows that under climate warming an increase in fragmentation (lower CI) will decrease distribution areas and increase the rate of extinction. Fragmentation can reduce population size and habitat connectivity, interfere with gene interchange, and reduce migration rates and resilience ( Chen & Bi, 2007; Sarmento Cabral et al., 2013), thus negatively affecting the long-term viability of threatened and endangered amphibians ( Opdam & Wascher, 2004).
